name: Dream Machine
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the original Dream Machine algorithm on the disting EX. It is designed to generate drones, allowing the user to explore non-traditional harmonies based on prime ratios. It was inspired by the theories of composer La Monte Young (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Monte_Young) [65] . An interesting read is the pdf “Notes on The Theatre of Eternal Music” available in a number of places online e.g. here (https://www.melafoundation.org/theatre.pdf) [66]. The output is a combination of five sounds – the fundamental and four harmonies. The prime ratios that define the frequency relationships are controlled by parameters. The algorithm uses wavetable synthesis to generate the tones. Additionally the fundamental may instead be a pure sine, triangle, or square wave. Each tone has a simple attack/release envelope, controlled by its own gate parameter. By default, little is mapped to the CV inputs, and it is perfectly possible to drive the algorithm entirely by hand. You may however like to map inputs as FM inputs, or to control the gates.

parameters.name: Wavetable
parameters.default: Chooses the wavetable for the oscillators.

parameters.name: Wave offset
parameters.description: Sets the position within the wavetable.

parameters.name: Wave input
parameters.description: Sets an input bus to modulate the wave offset.

parameters.name: Waveform
parameters.description: Chooses the waveform for the fundamental. The options are "Wavetable", "Sine", "Triangle", and "Square".

parameters.name: Prime 1
parameters.description: Sets one of the four primes that may be multiplied to create the denominator and numerators of the frequency ratios.

parameters.name: Octave
parameters.description: Sets an octave shift for the fundamental.

parameters.name: Transpose
parameters.description: Adjusts the tuning of all frequencies in (12-TET) semitone steps.

parameters.name: Denominator
parameters.description: Sets the denominator of the frequency ratios.

parameters.name: Numerator 1
parameters.description: Sets the numerator of the frequency ratio of tone 1.

parameters.name: Numerator 2
parameters.description: Sets the numerator of the frequency ratio of tone 2.

parameters.name: Numerator 3
parameters.description: Sets the numerator of the frequency ratio of tone 3.

parameters.name: Numerator 4
parameters.description: Sets the numerator of the frequency ratio of tone 4.

parameters.name: Gain 0
parameters.description: Gain for the fundamental. "-40" is treated as –∞dB.

parameters.name: FM input 1
parameters.description: Which input bus to use to frequency modulate (FM) tone 1. The input is scaled according to the FM Range parameter.

parameters.name: FM Range
parameters.description: Sets the scaling for the FM inputs. The options are 1Hz/V, 10Hz/V, 100Hz/V or 1kHz/V.

parameters.name: Frequency slew
parameters.description: Sets a slew rate for any change in voice frequency.

parameters.name: Crossfade time
parameters.description: Sets a crossfade time for any change in voice frequency.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.
